sourcesContent:
import './App.css'; function App() { return (
Scripture
“Wake up, sleeper, rise from the dead, and Christ will shine on you.” 15 Be very careful, then, how you live—not as unwise but as wise, 16 making the most of every opportunity, because the days are evil. 17 Therefore do not be foolish, but understand what the Lord’s will is. 18 Do not get drunk on wine, which leads to debauchery. Instead, be filled with the Spirit, 19 speaking to one another with psalms, hymns, and songs from the Spirit. Sing and make music from your heart to the Lord, 20 always giving thanks to God the Father for everything, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
{/*
Observation
To remain in the will of the Lord, I must be filled with songs of gratitude, songs of Spirit. It helps to fill my mind with psalms and mindful poems.
Application
Read one Psalm and two poems of gratefulness a day. Do separate reflections just like this for those.
Prayer
Lord, may I start by singing my praise to you, for this day, for this peaceful structure I am privileged to stay under at this time. For the food, for the sounds of the myna birds in the morning. For the inquisical and loving look given to me by my dogs who I do not pet enough. For the wonderful children whose lives I get to be a part of every day. For not condemning me even though I return to the trough occasionally. Help me to escape. Help me to at least stay rocksteady in this process: reading songs in the morning, singing praises through the day for you, for your good work, your wonderful creation. Help me to write poems at night. Thank you, in your son Jesus' name, Amen.
*/}
); } export default App;
